alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 2:57AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jefferson, Morris, Shawnee, northwestern Douglas, Wabaunsee, northern Osage, southeastern Jackson and northern Lyon Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 256 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winchester to 3 miles south of Keene to 9 miles northwest of Strong City. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, northwestern Lawrence, Council Grove, Carbondale, Valley Falls, Rossville, Oskaloosa, Alma, Eskridge, Tecumseh, Richland, Dover, Silver Lake, Auburn, Burlingame, Perry, Americus, McLouth, Meriden and Scranton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 329 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 132 and 201. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
